result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Brian K Degodt was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Brian K Degodt was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: No bail was posted on this case.   Total fine to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 6 days Huber for non-payment.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha Police Department.
To be paid within 90 days or penalty of 6 days Huber consecutive.

Defendant Brian K Degodt in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Wolff makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:
COUNT #1
75 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by tonight (9/2/2015) 8:00 p.m.

FINE:  $1179.00  $500.00 cashbail to be applied.  Remainder of fine due within 90 days, failure to pay; 6 days huber consecutive.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Waukesha Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  17 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 17 months.
Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through

The Court Orders the Following:
COUNT #2
FINE:  $694.00  Fine due within 90 days, failure to pay; 6 days huber consecutive.

Hearing on April 13, 2015 at 09:30 am.
09/03/2015:  No cash bail was posted on this case per Waukesha City Police and Waukesha County Jail.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report within the first business day after posting bail or released from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Bail is already posted.
